lines.content: Bim is an application that helps you keep track of your tasks
ensuring that you will not forget them.
Tasks are categorized into 3 different categories.
You can add tasks with your own description and date (if applicable) to Bim.
Tasks can also be deleted regardless of their status.
If you have completed your task, you can mark the task as completed. You can also set completed task as
You can search for any task that contains a keyword or a phrase that you want.
All tasks are saved into a text file at `[JAR file location]/data/BimData.txt`.
After any command that modifies the data, the file will be updated automatically.
- Words in `UPPERCASE` are parameters to be specified by the user.
- `INDEX` refers to the number shown in the `list` command.
I have added a new task!
Date must be in the format `yyyy-mm-dd`
I have added a new task!
I have added a new task!
Lists all tasks that Bim has in store.
### `mark` - Set the task to be completed
Sets the task with the given index to be completed.
Task has been marked. Well done!
### `unmark` - Set the task to be uncompleted
Sets the task with the given index to be incomplete.
The task with the given index will be deleted
### `find` - Find a task with a keyword
Lists all task that contains the keyword.
- `KEYWORD` can be a word or a phrase
These are the tasks containing your keyword!
* The frontend of the application where it is initialized.

* @return EventCommand if parameters are valid, IncorrectCommand otherwise.

* Create a new data directory and data file.

* Reads the data file. If the data file cannot be read, a new data file is created.
* Else, tasks are created from the content of the data file and added to an arraylist.
* TASK_TYPE - D for Deadline, E for Event and T for ToDo
* DATE - Deadline or time of event. '-' is used for ToDo tasks
* @return An arraylist of tasks imported from the data file.
* @throws BimException If the data file cannot be found and/or the directory and file could not be created.
* Saves a task in the data file.
* @throws BimException If file could not be written to.
public void writeData(Task newTask) throws BimException {
* Updates the file when a task is marked or unmarked.
* The whole file will be read line by line and changes will be made only to the task to be modified
* The data file will then be overwritten with the new content.
* @param index the index of the task to be marked / unmarked
* @throws BimException If file could not be written to.
public void modifyData(String mode, int index) throws BimException {
* Updates the file when a task is deleted
* The whole file will be read line by line and changes will be made only to the task to be deleted
* The data file will then be overwritten with the new content.
* @param index The index of the deleted task
* @throws BimException If the file could not be written to.
